meanings.definition: Art, objects, or design considered to be in poor taste because of excessive garishness or sentimentality.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with kitsch, from the bright pink flamingo decorations to the glittery unicorn statues.
meanings.sent2: The souvenir shop was full of kitsch, with its shelves lined with tacky keychains and gaudy magnets.
meanings.sent3: The kitsch overload in the restaurant made us chuckle as we tried to decipher the mismatched decor.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was a walking display of kitsch, clashing colors and over-the-top accessories.
meanings.sent5: The art exhibition was a sea of kitsch, overwhelming visitors with its excessive and tasteless displays.

meanings.definition: Something of tawdry design, appearance, or content created to appeal to popular or undiscriminating taste.
meanings.sent1: The movie was a prime example of kitsch, relying on cheap thrills and predictable plot twists.
meanings.sent2: The market was full of kitsch, with vendors selling mass-produced trinkets and flashy souvenirs.
meanings.sent3: The kitsch in the gift shop made us smile, as we picked up a quirky mug with a funny slogan.
meanings.sent4: His taste in music was pure kitsch, always going for the most mainstream and cliched songs.
meanings.sent5: The fashion show was a parade of kitsch, showcasing loud patterns and exaggerated silhouettes.
